instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on and chimes but no green light
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board which it turns on for a few seconds turns of and again turns on and stays on but there are two issues
1: even thou there is no green light on the charger the board stays on after second time.
2; second time that it turns on and stays on the screen lights up for a second and after that the voltage drops gradually from 31v to 8.6v.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on and chimes but no green light
threads.message: This sounds like an <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> issue. Tried known good DC in board and flat cable?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on and chimes but no green light
threads.message:
3437 board starts after two power cycles, so is normal.

Change <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>, possibly corrosion on its FB solder...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on and chimes but no green light
threads.message:
Dear Sir, Thanks for your replay, I've tested it with two other known working dc in boards. same result.
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> on keyboard connector pin 1 shows 1.5v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on and chimes but no green light
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on and chimes but no green light
threads.message: Please don't use comments we won't see it. If <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is 1.5 volts no matter what DC in/cable you're using, you have an issue with that data line. Inspect J9500, trackpad connector, and around the SMC for corrosion

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns on and chimes but no green light
threads.message:
Disconnect trackpad and LIO flex cables.
If <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> is still low, check <CAPACITOR>C4834</CAPACITOR> and <RESISTOR>R5171</RESISTOR>.
If stays at 3V without LIO board connected, check lid sensor from LIO...
